summary: Rufo Lopez Fresquet is mentioned in three documents. While the documents do not explicitly detail his role or significance in the JFK assassination context, they provide insights into his connections within the Cuban exile community and potential involvement in anti-Castro activities. He appears in documents related to Cuban double agents, reviews of files concerning Manuel Ray y Rivero, and activities related to the Committee for the Liberation of the One Hundred. The documents suggest Fresquet was part of a network of individuals involved in anti-Castro efforts during the 1960s.
significance: The significance of Rufo Lopez Fresquet in the JFK context is not explicitly stated in the provided documents. However, his association with anti-Castro activities and figures within the Cuban exile community suggests a potential connection to groups or individuals who may have had motives related to the assassination.
